intro: Calyptranthes tridymantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Calyptranthes tridymantha plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
